wikitext.*:
'''''unque''''' is a noun meaning "a hollow" in [[Quenya]].<ref name="Names">{{App|Letters}}, Note, ''The names of the letters''</ref>

[[Image:Unque.gif|left]]''Unque'' is also the name in Quenya of the sixteenth letter of the [[Tengwar]] alphabet.<ref name="Names"/>  It is the fourth letter of the fourth grade or [[Tyellë]], which contains "voiced spirants" and it is the fourth letter in the fourth series of consonants.<ref name="Letters">{{App|Letters}}</ref>    In the standard spelling of Quenya this letter represents '''NKW''' (or transcribed in English as '''NQU''')<ref name="Names"/> while in [[Sindarin]] this letter represents '''GHW'''.  In [[Westron]] the fourth series is used for the ''k''-series, the ''[[Calmatéma]]'', and this letter represents '''GH'''.<ref name="Letters"/>  The Westron name for this letter is '''''Agha'''''.<ref>See ''[[Alphabet of Fëanor: Numenian, or Westron, Mode]]''</ref>

==Etymology==
The word derives from the [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarme|root]] [[UNUK]].<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, UNUK-</ref>
